gurmukhi: iek krq kSt kr DUmR pwn ] iek krq BwNq BwNqn Snwn ] iek rhq ie`k pg jug pRmwn ] kyeI aUrDbwh muin mn mhwn ]145]
transliteration: Ik Karat Kasht Kar Dhoomra Paan|| Ik Karat Bhaant Bhaantan Shanaan|| Ik Rahat Ikk Pag Joug Pramaan|| Keioordhbaah Mounndi) Man Mahaan||145||
translation: Many taking in smoke endured suffering and many took baths of different kinds; many stood on their foot for ages and many great sages turned their arms upwards.145.

gurmukhi: iek rhq bYiT jil m`iD jwie ] iek qpq Awig aUrD jrwie ] iek krq nXws khu ibiD pRkwr ] iek rhq eyk Awsw ADwr ]146]
transliteration: Ik Rahat Baith(i) Jal(i) Maddh(i) Jaae|| Ik Tapat Aag(i) Ooradh Jaraae|| Ik Karat Nyaas Kauh Bidh(i) Prakaar|| Ik Rahat Ek Aasaa Adhaar||146||
translation: Someone sat down in water and many made themselves warm by burning fire; someone practiced various postures and someone continued to live on the strength of one desire.146.

gurmukhi: kyeI kbhUM nIc nhI krq fIT ] kyeI qpq Awg prjwr pIT ] kyeI bYT krq bRqcrj dwn ] kyeI Drq ic`q eykY inDwn ]147]
transliteration: Keikab-hoon Neech Nahikarat Dheeth|| Keitapat Aag Parjaar Peeth|| Keibaith Karat Bratcharaj Daan|| Keidharat Chitt Ekai Nidhaan||147||
translation: There are many who do not see below and many warm themselves by burning fire on their back; some sit down and hold fasts and bestow charities and many are absorbed only in One Lord.147.

gurmukhi: kyeI krq j`ig Aru hom dwn ] kyeI BwNq BwNq ibDviq Snwn ] kyeI Drq jwie lY ipSt pwn ] kyeI dyq krm kI Cwif bwn 148 ]
transliteration: Kei Karat Jagg(i) Ar(u) Hom Daan|| Keibhaant Bhaant Bidhvat(i) Shanaan|| Keidharat Jaae Lai Pisht Paan|| Keidet Karam Kichhaad(i) Baan||148||
translation: Many take bath according to Shastric injuctions in various ways; and many are busy in Yajnas charities and hom; many are standing with their hands touching the earth at their back and many forsaking crores of rupees are donating whatever they have with th

gurmukhi: kyeI krq bYT prmM pRkwS ] kyeI BRmq p`b bn bn audws ] kyeI rhq eyk Awsn Afol ] koeI jpq bYT muK mMqR Amol ]149]
transliteration: Kei Karat Baith Paramannd Prakaadh|| Keibhrama Pabb Ban Ban Udaas|| Keirahat Ek Aasan Adol|| Keijapat Baith Moukh Mantra Amol||149||
translation: Many are sitting in Supreme Light and many are roaming unattached on mountain and in the forest; many are sitting in one posture and many are reciting mantras.149.

gurmukhi: kyeI krq bYT hir hir aucwr ] kyeI krq pwT mun mn adwr ] kyeI Bgq Bwv Bgvq BjMq ] kyeI ircw byd isMmiRq rtMq ]150]
transliteration: Kaikarat Baith Har(i) Har(i) Ouchaar|| Keikarat Paath Mounndman Udaar|| Keibhagad Bhaav Bhagvat Bhajant|| Keirichaa Bed Sinmrit Ratant||150||
translation: Some are uttering the Name of the Lord while sitting and some sages are reading the religious text with a generous heart; many are meditating on the Lord with devotion and many are repeating the Vedic verses and Smritis.150.

gurmukhi: kyeI eyk pwn AsiQq Afol ] kyeI jpq jwp min ic`q Kol ] kyeI khq eyk mn inrwhwr ] iek BCq paun mun mn audwr ]151]
transliteration: Keiek Paan Asthit Adol|| Keijapat Jaap Man(i) Chitt Dhol|| Keikahat Ek Man Niraahaar|| Ik Bhachhat Paoun Mounndman Udaar||151||
translation: Many are standing on one hand and many are reciting mantras with fullness of mind; many go without food and many sages only subsist on air.151.

gurmukhi: iek krq nXws Awsw ibhIn ] iek rhq eyk Bgvq ADIn ] iek krq nYk bn Pl Ahwr ] iek rtq nwm isAwmw Apwr ]152]
transliteration: Ik Karat Nyaas Aasaa Niheen|| Ik Rahat Ek Bhagvat Adheen|| Ik Karat Naik Ban Phal Ahaar|| Ik Ratat Naam Siaamaa|| Apaar||152||
translation: Many are sitting in postures, abandoning their desires and expectations and many have resigned themselves to the support of the Lord; Many are subsisting on small quantity of fruit in the forest and many are only repeating the Name of the Lord.152.

gurmukhi: iek eyk Aws Awsw ibrhq ] iek bhuq BwNiq duK dyh shq ] iek khq eyk hirko kQwn ] iek mukq pqR pwvq indwn ]153]
transliteration: Ike K Aas Aasaa Birhat|| Ik Bahout Bhaant(i) Doukh Deh Sahat|| Ik Kahat Ek Har(i)ko Kaihaan|| Ik Moukat Patra Paavat Nidaan||153||
translation: Many are abiding only with the hope of meeting the Lord and many are enduring many kinds of sufferings; Many are busy in speaking a discourse of the Lord and many are ultimately obtaining salvation.153.

gurmukhi: iek pry Srin hir ky duAwr ] iek rhq qws nwmY ADwr ] iek jpq nwm qwko durMq ] iek AMiq mukq pwvq ibAMq ]154]
transliteration: Ik Dare Sharan(i) Har(i) Ke Duaar|| Ik Rahat Taas Naamai Adhaar|| Ik Japat Naam Taako Durant|| Ik Ant(i) Moukat Paavat Beant||154||
translation: Many have come under the refuge of the Lord and their support is only the name of the Lord; Many are repeating His Name and are ultimately obtaining salvation.154.

gurmukhi: iek krq nwm ins idn aucwr ] iek Agn hoqR bHmw ibcwr ] iek SwsqR srb isMmiRq rtMq ] iek swD rIq insidn clMq ]155]
transliteration: Ik Karat Naam Nis Din Ouchaar|| Ik Agad Hotra Brahmaa Bichaar|| Ik Shaastra Sarab Sinmrit Ratant|| Ik Saadh Reet Nidsin Chalant||155||
translation: Many are uttering the Name of the Lord day and night and many adopting the thought of the Lord in their mind, are performing Agnihotra (the rite of fire-offering); many are repeating for memory the Shastras and Smritis and many are continuously observing

gurmukhi: iek hom dwn Aru byd rIq ] iek rtq bYT Kt SwsqR mIq ] iek krq byd cwro aucwr ] iek igAwn gwQ mihmw Apwr ]156]
transliteration: Ik Hom Daan Ar(u) Bed Reet|| Ik Ratat Baith Khat Shaastra Meet|| Ik Karat Bed Chdaro Ouchaar|| Ik Giaan Gadth Mahimaa Apaar||156||
translation: Many are performing the acts of hom and charity according to Vedic injunctions and many friends sitting together are cramming the six Shastras; many are reciting the four Vedas and are describing the infinite greatness of the discussion about knowledge.15

gurmukhi: iek BwNq BwNq imstwn Boj ] bhu dIn bol BC dyq roj ] keI kyrq bYT bhu BwNq pwT ] kyeI AMin iqAwig cwbMq kwT ]157]
transliteration: Ik Bhaant Bhaant Mistaan Bhoj|| Bahu Deen Bol Bhachh Det Roj|| Kaikarat Baith Bahu Bhaant Paath|| Kiann(i) Tiaag(i) Chaabant Kaadh||157||
translation: Many are ever calling lowly and afflicted ones and serving them sweets and food; many are busy in reciting the religious texts in various ways and many forsaking the corn, are just chewing the wood.157.

gurmukhi: kyeI BwNq BwNq so Drq iDAwn ] kyeI krq bYT hir kiRq kwn ] kyeI sunq pwT krmM punIq ] nhI murq klp bhu jwq bIq ]158]
transliteration: Keibhaant Bhaant So Dharat Dhiaan|| Keikarat Baith Har(i) Krit Kaan|| Keisounat Paath Karamannd Pouneet|| Nahimurat Kalap Bahu Jaat Beet||158||
translation: Many are meditating in various ways and many, while sitting, are elucidating about various works of the Lord; many are listening to the recitation of the holy religious texts, while sitting and many do not look back even for many Kalpas (ages).158.
